RESPONSE TEXT: What this place just has farmers? Shit, all they want are pipe pistols and stupid ammo. Where's the maniacs slobbering for a mininuke, am I right

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Let's see what you've got.
RESPONSE TEXT: Oh, goody. Let's make mischief.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Let's see what you've got.
RESPONSE TEXT: A part of every big purchase goes to planting little bitty trees that I'll blow up in your honor.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Let's see what you've got.
RESPONSE TEXT: Guns, guns, and more guns. Just for you.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Let's see what you've got.
RESPONSE TEXT: Just think how damned good it'll feel holding one of... these.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Let's see what you've got.
RESPONSE TEXT: And there they are. Did your heart skip a beat, too?

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Not interested.
RESPONSE TEXT: Aww. Don't leave. We were just having fun.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Not interested.
RESPONSE TEXT: You leading me on, scavver? Figures.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Not interested.
RESPONSE TEXT: Then I guess I'll just have to sell them to someone else.
SCRIPT NOTES: A little menace, "I will sell this gun to someone who wants to kill you."

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Not interested.
RESPONSE TEXT: Eh, there'll be other customers. Always are.
SCRIPT NOTES: She's annoyed, trying not to act it

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'll think about it.
RESPONSE TEXT: Less time thinking, more time blowing shit up.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'll think about it.
RESPONSE TEXT: Sure, I have all the time in the world. Asshole.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'll think about it.
RESPONSE TEXT: Make up your mind, already.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'll think about it.
RESPONSE TEXT: Buy my damned guns, already. Please.
SCRIPT NOTES: Strung out, then tries to salvage the sale

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What kind of stuff do you have?
RESPONSE TEXT: If it can chamber, cock, and spit out lead -- then I sell it. I sell slashers and clobberers, too, for those  maniacs that like it up close.
SCRIPT NOTES: Bantery - worked out her sales pitch, savoring it

RESPONSE TEXT: But hot death flying faster than the speed of sound... Oh, my knees are getting weak just from thinking about it.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let's see what you've got.
SCRIPT NOTES: She really does get weak in the knees. Unnatural love for guns.

RESPONSE TEXT: Keep helping Bunker Hill, and I get better supplies. Then you can blow even bigger holes in people. Psst. Want a new gun?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let's see what you've got.

RESPONSE TEXT: If you're such a big shot, helping all the merchants, why aren't you buying my guns? Now?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let's see what you've got.
SCRIPT NOTES: Trying not to be super-impressed by the player

RESPONSE TEXT: C'mon, c'mon. Get your guns here. Small booms. Big booms. I got 'em all.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let's see what you've got.

RESPONSE TEXT: Got a hankering for melting face? Then I'm your girl.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let's see what you've got.

RESPONSE TEXT: Better buy my big guns now, because you bet your ass your enemies will.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let's see what you've got.

RESPONSE TEXT: Soooo many guns, and so little time. You just gotta buy them.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let's see what you've got.

RESPONSE TEXT: Everyone wants a piece of what I got.
I got so many flavors of mayhem for sale.
Ammo, weapons, and messy death - I got it all.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Companion: It's been a while since you've had anything to report.
RESPONSE TEXT: Well, you know how it is. Sometimes things are just quiet.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Companion: It's been a while since you've had anything to report.
RESPONSE TEXT: I guess the road's kept me busy, but if I see any runaway synths, you'll be the first to know.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Companion: It's been a while since you've had anything to report.
RESPONSE TEXT: Maybe you Coursers are doing such a good job, there aren't any synths left to capture.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Companion: It's been a while since you've had anything to report.
RESPONSE TEXT: To be honest, I just haven't see anything that was worth telling you about.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Companion: It's been a while since you've had anything to report.
RESPONSE TEXT: That's just how it's been. You guys have put the fear in those runaway synths, and now they won't show their faces.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Companion: It's been a while since you've had anything to report.
RESPONSE TEXT: You haven't missed anything, I promise. It's been quiet as a whisper out here.
